IV Sedation

Deep sedation for nervous patients. Currently, IV Sedation is only available in our Garden City location.

Comfort for Anxious Patients

Deep sedation for nervous patients helps you receive necessary dental care in complete comfort. Our IV sedation creates a deeply relaxed state where you'll have little to no memory of the procedure.

Important Notice

Currently, IV Sedation is only available in our Garden City location (211-2305 McPhillips Street). Please contact this office directly to schedule your sedation appointment.

What is IV Sedation?

Intravenous (IV) sedation, also known as "twilight sleep," is a form of conscious sedation that helps patients achieve a deep state of relaxation during dental procedures. Unlike general anesthesia, you remain conscious and can respond to verbal cues, but you'll feel extremely relaxed and have little to no memory of the treatment.

Deep Relaxation

Feel completely calm and at ease throughout treatment

Conscious Sedation

Remain conscious and able to respond while deeply relaxed

Minimal Memory

Little to no recollection of the dental procedure

Who Benefits from IV Sedation?

Ideal Candidates

  • High dental anxiety or phobia: Patients who avoid dental care due to fear
  • Complex or lengthy procedures: Multiple extractions, oral surgery, implants
  • Gag reflex issues: Strong gag reflex that interferes with treatment
  • Physical disabilities: Conditions that make positioning difficult
  • Traumatic dental experiences: Previous negative dental encounters

Medical Considerations

While IV sedation is safe for most patients, certain medical conditions require special consideration:

  • • Heart conditions or blood pressure issues
  • • Respiratory problems or sleep apnea
  • • Liver or kidney disease
  • • Drug allergies or medication interactions
  • • Pregnancy or nursing

Important: A thorough medical history review is required before sedation

The IV Sedation Process

1

Pre-Treatment Consultation

We'll review your medical history, discuss your anxiety concerns, and explain the sedation process. Pre-operative instructions include fasting for 6-8 hours before treatment.

Requirements: Adult escort required for transportation home after treatment
2

Treatment Day Preparation

We'll take your vital signs, place monitoring equipment, and establish IV access. Sedation medication is administered gradually until you reach optimal comfort level.

Monitoring: Heart rate, blood pressure, and oxygen levels continuously monitored
3

During Your Procedure

You'll remain conscious but deeply relaxed. Local anesthetic is still used for complete comfort. The sedation level can be adjusted throughout the procedure as needed.

Experience: Time will seem to pass quickly with little memory of the procedure
4

Post-Treatment Recovery

Recovery time varies but typically takes 30-60 minutes. We monitor you until you're stable and alert enough for discharge with your escort. Full recovery takes several hours.

Restrictions: No driving, operating machinery, or important decisions for 24 hours

Safety & Monitoring

Safety Protocols

  • ✓
    Board-certified anesthesia provider supervision
  • ✓
    State-of-the-art monitoring equipment
  • ✓
    Emergency medications and equipment on-site
  • ✓
    Comprehensive pre-sedation health screening
  • ✓
    Post-sedation recovery monitoring

Continuous Monitoring

Pulse Oximetry

Blood oxygen levels monitored continuously

EKG Monitoring

Heart rhythm and rate tracking

Blood Pressure

Regular blood pressure measurements

Capnography

Carbon dioxide levels in exhaled breath

Preparing for IV Sedation

Before Your Appointment

  • No food or drink for 6-8 hours before treatment
  • Arrange for a responsible adult escort
  • Take only prescribed medications as directed
  • Wear comfortable, loose-fitting clothing
  • Remove contact lenses, jewelry, and nail polish

After Your Appointment

  • Rest at home for the remainder of the day
  • Have your escort stay with you for several hours
  • Start with clear fluids, advance to light foods
  • Follow post-operative care instructions
  • Avoid alcohol and sedating medications

Comfortable Dental Care for Anxious Patients

Don't let dental anxiety prevent you from getting the care you need. Our IV sedation service at our Garden City location provides a comfortable, stress-free dental experience.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is IV sedation safe?

Yes, IV sedation is very safe when administered by trained professionals. We use advanced monitoring equipment and have emergency protocols in place. All patients receive a thorough medical screening before sedation to ensure safety.

Will I be unconscious during IV sedation?

No, IV sedation is "conscious sedation" - you remain awake and can respond to verbal cues. However, you'll be deeply relaxed and likely have little to no memory of the procedure. This is different from general anesthesia where you're completely unconscious.

How long does IV sedation last?

The sedation effects typically last 30-60 minutes after the IV is stopped, but full recovery can take several hours. You'll need someone to drive you home and stay with you until the effects fully wear off, usually by the next morning.

What procedures can be done with IV sedation?

IV sedation can be used for most dental procedures, especially complex ones like oral surgery, multiple extractions, implant placement, and extensive restorative work. We'll determine if sedation is appropriate for your specific treatment during consultation.
